alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 31 at 11:57AM AKST until January 02 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills and blowing snow expected. Expect wind chills to 65 below zero. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph in the passes will result in periods of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Southeastern Brooks Range. * WHEN...Until noon Sunday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Blowing snow will cause reductions in visibility to one half mile or less at times. Avalanches may be possible in steep terrain. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of very cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create dangerously low wind chill values. Frost bite can occur quickly and even hypothermia or death if precautions are not taken.
